messages.content: How can I install the psd2png node in ComfyUI?
To install the psd2png node in ComfyUI, you need to ensure you are in the ComfyUI Python environment and run the command `pip install psd-tools`.
What is the default psd_path for the psd2png node?
The default psd_path for the psd2png node is C:/example.psd. However, this path has no effect. The node will use the psd file corresponding to the changed psd_path or the uploaded psd file.
How are the layer numbers assigned in a psd file for the psd2png node?
In a psd file, the topmost layer has the largest number, and the bottommost layer is assigned the number 1.
What does the image output of the psd2png node represent?
The image output of the psd2png node represents the image of the psd layer corresponding to the layer_index. When layer_index is 0, the image output is the full image of the psd.
What does the top_image output of the psd2png node represent?
The top_image output of the psd2png node represents the image of the topmost layer in the psd.
What does the mask output of the psd2png node represent?
The mask output of the psd2png node represents the mask corresponding to the layer_index.
Is there a visual example available for the psd2png node?
Yes, there is a visual example available for the psd2png node. You can find it at the following link: https://github.com/violet-chen/comfyui-psd2png/blob/master/images/image.png?raw=true
